poem:
Title: Border Crossing

To Rafah's heart marched the iron-clad fist,
Flags flying, a day before peace may exist.
A journey through turmoil, in sand etched with grief,
Under the shadowed wing of an unwelcome thief.
When guns converse and children hide in fear,
Who dares to whisper of ceasefires near?
In this dance of powers, where hate's the host,
Remember - in war, it's innocence lost.
